documentation.text:
@title kyberTokenFeeHandler
 * @dev kyberTokenFeeHandler works tightly with contracts kyberNetwork and kyberDao.
     Some events are moved to interface, for easier usage
@dev Terminology:
         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.
             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.
         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:
             Burning KNC
             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers
             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.
@dev Code flow:
     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which
         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:
             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.
             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.
             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using
sanity rate.
             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.
     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage 
         from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

@dev set new kyberNetwork address by daoOperator
 @param _kyberNetwork new kyberNetwork contract

@dev Allow to set kyberNetworkProxy address by daoOperator
 @param _newProxy new kyberNetworkProxy contract

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract IERC20,contract IERC20,uint256,uint256,bytes memory) view external returns (uint256)
literal_string "total reward less than epoch reward"

arguments.value: total reward less than epoch reward

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "total reward less than epoch reward"

documentation.text: @dev return latest knc/eth rate from sanity rate contract

attributes.text:
@title kyberTokenFeeHandler
 * @dev kyberTokenFeeHandler works tightly with contracts kyberNetwork and kyberDao.
     Some events are moved to interface, for easier usage
@dev Terminology:
         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.
             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.
         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:
             Burning KNC
             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers
             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.
@dev Code flow:
     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which
         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:
             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.
             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.
             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using
sanity rate.
             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.
     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage 
         from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

@dev set new kyberNetwork address by daoOperator
 @param _kyberNetwork new kyberNetwork contract

@dev Allow to set kyberNetworkProxy address by daoOperator
 @param _newProxy new kyberNetworkProxy contract

attributes.type: function (contract IERC20,contract IERC20,uint256,uint256,bytes memory) view external returns (uint256)

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "total reward less than epoch reward"

attributes.type: literal_string "total reward less than epoch reward"
attributes.value: total reward less than epoch reward

attributes.text: @dev return latest knc/eth rate from sanity rate contract

devdoc.details: kyberTokenFeeHandler works tightly with contracts kyberNetwork and kyberDao.     Some events are moved to interface, for easier usageTerminology:         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:             Burning KNC             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.Code flow:     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using sanity rate.             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage          from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

burnKnc().details: Burn knc. The burn amount is limited. Forces block delay between burn calls.only none ontract can call this function

claimPlatformFee(address).details: claim accumulated fee per platform wallet. Called by any address

params.platformWallet: the wallet to claim fee for. Total accumulated fee sent to this wallet.

claimReserveRebate(address).details: claim reabate per reserve wallet. called by any address

params.rebateWallet: the wallet to claim rebates for. Total accumulated rebate sent to this wallet.

claimStakerReward(address,uint256).details: not revert if already claimed or reward percentage is 0      to allow writing a wrapper to claim for multiple epochs

params.epoch: for which epoch the staker is claiming the reward

getLatestSanityRate().details: return latest knc/eth rate from sanity rate contract

getSanityRateContracts().details: returns list of sanity rate contractsindex 0 is currently used contract address, indexes > 0 are older versions

handleFees(address,address[],uint256[],a.details: handleFees function is called per trade on kyberNetwork. unless the trade is not involving any fees.

params.networkFee: Fee amount (in wei) to be allocated for BRR
params.platformFee: Fee amount (in wei) the platfrom wallet is entitled to.
params.platformWallet: Wallet address that will receive the platfrom fee.
params.rebateBpsPerWallet: percentage of rebate for each wallet, out of total rebate.
params.rebateWallets: a list of rebate wallets that will get rebate for this trade.

makeEpochRewardBurnable(uint256).details: if no one voted for an epoch (like epoch 0), no one gets rewards - should burn it.         Will move the epoch reward amount to burn amount. So can later be burned.         calls kyberDao contract to check if there were any votes for this epoch.
